# DOM The package helps to access or manipulate HTML elements using JavaScript. The method are similar to HTML DOM methods, but they are build as [Tasks](url) (lazy Promises). ## Usage ## createElement() a [Task](url)-based method, that creates the HTML element specified by _tagName_ or `DOMFailure` if _tagName_ isn't recognized - **Resolved:** creates element - **Rejected:** returns [DOMFailure](##DOMFailure) ### Parametrs ``` tagName: string ``` ### Return value ``` noop ``` ### Examples ```html getElementById example

Hello world!

``` ```js const dom = require('dom'); document.body.createElement('div').fork( (err) => console.error(err), (newDiv) => { const newContent = document.createTextNode("Hi there and greetings!"); newDiv.appendChild(newContent); } ) ``` ## getElementById() a [Task](url)-based method, that returns an element object representing the element whose id or `ElementNotFound` if `elementId` property doesn't match the specified string. - **Resolved:** returns DOM element or `ElementNotFound` - **Rejected:** returns [DOMFailure](#DOMFailure) ### Parametrs ``` elementId: string ``` ### Return value ``` noop ``` ### Examples ```html getElementById example

Hello world!

``` ```js const dom = require('dom'); function changeColor(newColor) { dom.getElementById('text').fork( (err) => console.error(err), (elem) => { elem.style.color = newColor } ) } ``` ## appendChild() a [Task](url)-based method, that adds a node to the end of the list of children of a specified parent node. - **Resolved:** returns added node - **Rejected:** returns [DOMFailure](#DOMFailure) ### Parametrs ``` existingEl: HTMLElement // The parent node newChild: HTMLElement // The node to append to the given parent node ``` ### Return value ``` noop ``` ### Syntax ```html appendChild example

Hello world!

``` ```js const dom = require('dom'); dom.createElement('div').fork( (err) => console.error(err), (newDiv) => { const newContent = document.createTextNode("Hi there and greetings!"); newDiv.appendChild(newContent); } ) Task.succeed<>().andThen(find).map() dom.appendChild(document.body, document.createElement('p')).fork( (err) => console.error(err), (elem) => ); ``` ## removeChild() a [Task](url)-based method, that removes a child node from the DOM and returns the removed node. - **Resolved:** returns removed node - **Rejected:** returns [DOMFailure](#DOMFailure) ### Syntax ``` removeChild(parent, child) ``` ### Parametrs ``` parent: HTMLElement, child: HTMLElement ``` ### Return value ``` noop ``` ## ElementNotFound ``` interface ElementNotFound { kind: 'element-not-found'; message: string; } ``` ## DOMFailure ``` interface DOMFailure { kind: 'dom-failure'; message: string; } ```
